justification: “As a personality model, we employed the widely used Myers-Briggs-Type-Indicator (MBTI) that divides the general population … into 16 mutually exclusive subpopulations with distinct personalities.”
“The first dimension is ‘Introversion’ (I) versus ‘Extroversion’ (E) …” indicating this trait is assessed within the MBTI.
“The ‘Intuition’ (N) versus ‘Sensing’ dichotomy constitutes the second dimension …” describing another MBTI-measured trait.
“The third dimension, ‘Thinking’ (T) versus ‘Feeling’ (F) …” showing this construct is captured by the MBTI.
“‘Perceiving’ (P) versus ‘Judging’ (J) is the last dimension …” again referring to MBTI measurement.
“Differences in behavior can be caused by … personality traits that have been measured in models such as the Five Factor Model (FFM).”
